title: Good music?
content:
Does anyone know where I could get some good background music for video games, preferably something that's more soft?

Thanks.~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
I've changed a lot since my last time on this forum...

title: Re: Good music?
content:
[url=http://midipage.sitecreations.nl/default.asp]Midi Page[/url]

Take a look...I'm sure you'll find something here.[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] [img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v426/RoboRed/RoboredSig2.jpg[/img]

title: Re: Good music?
content:
[url=http://www.vgmusic.com]VG Music[/url] - Contains MIDI music remade from games, but can be used just as well for your own games.___________________
DaVince, Yet Another Amateur Game Creator! :P

title: bleh
content:
I used to be a big supporter of VgMusic.com, until they disallowed what they considered "rips" of game music. That is to say, if someone uses a program to read the music data directly out of the ROM and encode it in MIDI format, that file is not allowed on the site. Why? I have no idea.

If I wanted a remix of game music, I'd find an mp3 formatted file from Overclocked.org or something. If I'm snagging a MIDI, I'd like it to be as close to the original system's music as possible!

title: Re: bleh
content:
www.OCremix.org contains a lot of MP3 remixes too.___________________
DaVince, Yet Another Amateur Game Creator! :P

title: Re: bleh
content:
lol, I meant for video games quite literally. I'm parusing through my Midi's that sound good. But I'm checking out that Midi site right now.. Hopefully it should help.~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
I've changed a lot since my last time on this forum...

title: Re: bleh
content:
You could try the ChipTune Archive, it has a lot of Adlib music of a similar era and sound to Keen (and you can download the entire archive in one .zip file.)

[url=http://chiptunes.back2roots.org/]chiptunes.back2roots.org/[/url]
